javadoc:
Interface for providing column data and a table's DataSource to a constraint editor.  Some editors
 require access to the table column data.  One example is a String "Starts With" column might
 pre-process the data to provide an autocompletion feature in the editor.
@param <T> the column data type.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the name of the column being filtered.
@return the name of the column being filtered.
methods.name: getColumnName
methods.comment: Returns the name of the column being filtered.

return.comment: the name of the column being filtered.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the number of column values (unfiltered table row count)
@return the number of column values (unfiltered table row count)
methods.name: getCount
methods.comment: Returns the number of column values (unfiltered table row count)

return.comment: the number of column values (unfiltered table row count)

methods.name: getColumnValue
methods.comment: Returns the column value for the given row.

params.name: row
params.comment: the row for which to get the column value.

return.comment: the column value for the given row.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the table's DataSource.
@return the table's DataSource.
methods.name: getTableDataSource

name: ColumnData
comment:
Interface for providing column data and a table's DataSource to a constraint editor.  Some editors
 require access to the table column data.  One example is a String "Starts With" column might
 pre-process the data to provide an autocompletion feature in the editor.
